result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program/Wisconsin Substance Program , If deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

superMiscConds.notes:
Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation, and follow any recommended treatment.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine sreens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant to report as a sex offender for a 15 year reporting period.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael S Davis in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by:  defendant's mother, Latasha L.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
Credit given for 123 days time served, per the Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1, AMENDED):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
*Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant to report as a sex offender for a 15 year reporting period.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Defendant's Character Witness Letters.
Defendant's Letter of Apology.

Defendant Michael S Davis in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  3rd Degree Sexual Assault [a Class G FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g).

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
filed by ADA Kevin Shomin on behalf of the State.  Count #1 is AMENDED to:  3rd Degree Sexual Assault [a Class G FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g).

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Michael S Davis not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
Case adjourned to 09-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Michael S Davis not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
Case adjourned to 08-31-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Michael S Davis not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Michael S Davis not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has discovery and needs time to review.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael S Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Michael S Davis in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Barbara Court-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit #1 is withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: NSF (dob:10/7/99).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael S Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael S Davis in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4). 

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
